alert.note: Alert for Marion (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 5:53PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A shower with brief funnel clouds will impact portions of southeastern Marion County through 615 PM EDT... At 551 PM EDT, Doppler radar and storm spotters were tracking a rain shower capable of producing funnel clouds and possibly a brief landspout near Southport, or 8 miles southeast of Indianapolis, moving south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and possible brief landspout, and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Marion County, including the following locations... Homecroft. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
